item.title: Splitgate 2 Devs Beg Fans: ‚ÄòGive Us One More Chance At Our Relaunch‚Äô
item.content:encoded:
In a social media post, the Splitgate 2 development team at 1047 Games promoted the #StopKillingGames campaign. It was seen as somewhat ironic by some gamers, and they took to the comment section under the post to jibe or berate 1047 following the disastrous, self-imploding launch of Splitgate 2 in June.

After Splitgate 2 failed to make a mark in June, hampered by controversial comments and decisions made by 1047 Games‚Äô leadership team, the game was pulled back to beta. The fans left waiting are now holding out for another launch, but we don‚Äôt know when that‚Äôll be.

Splitgate 2 Didn‚Äôt Make FPS Great Again

The downfall of Splitgate 2 began when 1047 Games CEO Ian Proulx took to the stage at Summer Game Fest to make some controversial statements about his title. He was wearing a hat emblazoned with the message ‚ÄòMake FPS Great Again‚Äô, which was enough to trigger many gamers worldwide.

Following that, some microtransaction prices and design choices further impacted the Splitgate 2 launch, and once the creators moved away from the game, the player count crumbled.

In a post on social media, the 1047 Games team was caught begging fans to still have faith:

The ‚Äòone more chance‚Äô comment was followed up with a similar sentiment:

Totally understand we‚Äôve disappointed. Hope we‚Äôll be able to earn your trust back!

And in another:

We‚Äôve definitely made some mistakes along the way, but supporting our community is always our top priority.

It‚Äôs unlikely that Splitgate 2 will be able to make much of a splash when it does eventually re-emerge. The damage has been done, and despite the game boasting some innovative mechanics, players won‚Äôt forget what happened this year with the game‚Äôs original launch.

Are you waiting for Splitgate 2 to come out (again)? Let me know on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Is Roblox Shutting Down? Roblox Ban in 2025 Explained
item.content:encoded:
Following a string of controversies and concerns about child safety, Roblox has become the target of several campaigns demanding action, such as the resignation of the CEO of the Roblox Corporation. Many believe that Roblox is shutting down in 2025, collapsing under the weight of all these scandals, but is it true, and will a Roblox ban surface this year?

It‚Äôs time to clear this up once and for all. Is Roblox getting shut down, and if not, why do so many people think it is?

Is Roblox Getting Shut Down on September 1st?

Across social media and content platforms, a ‚Äòhoax campaign‚Äô was kicked off, claiming that Roblox will be banned from September 1st. This somewhat ludicrous claim came amidst an ongoing debate regarding the safety of children on the platform.

It‚Äôs no big secret that there‚Äôs an inherent problem at the heart of Roblox. The game is being sued by the state of Louisiana, Chris ‚ÄòTo Catch a Predator‚Äô Hansen is making a documentary about it, and content creators are trapping malicious users on the platform.

But is this enough to warrant Roblox shutting down?

When is Roblox Shutting Down?

Roblox is not shutting down on September 1st, or any other date. The game is not going to be taken offline because of the ongoing controversies, as it still functions as a popular platform for tens of millions of gamers worldwide.

Roblox indeed has an insane and very public issue right now, but it‚Äôs not enough to bring the game to a complete shutdown.

If you‚Äôre one of the many users wondering if Roblox is being banned, fear not ‚Äì the game is safe for now.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming forum if you have any concerns about the security of Roblox right now.

item.title: Fate Trigger Release Window & Crossplay Announced at Gamescom
item.content:encoded:
Fate Trigger will release into early access in the first quarter of 2026, Saroasis Studios has confirmed, alongside confirmation that crossplay is among the features being worked on.

The title, which attracted over half a million players during a Closed Beta on PC, combines an anime-inspired art style with the established Battle Royale genre.

The countdown is now on for Fate Trigger‚Äòs early access release early next year, and, while a solid date was not announced, fans were given an insight into what to expect on the road ahead.

Fate Trigger to Add Crossplay & First-Person Modes

In a press release sent to Insider Gaming, Saroasis Studios announced plans to add cross-platform play and first-person point of view for select game modes, which will arrive in a future update.

Additional future plans include evolving into a ‚Äúliving universe,‚Äù featuring Esports and other competitions, ongoing world-building, and physical media releases.

The flood of reveals for the future of Fate Trigger indicates the long-term plans the studio has to support the title in the future, with more news due to be shared as the release window edges closer.

item.title: Bungie CEO Pete Parsons Stepping Down, Replacement Named
item.content:encoded:
Longtime CEO of Bungie, Pete Parsons, is stepping down from his position as of today. The news came right in the midst of Gamescom, but a replacement has been named, fortunately.

Parsons, who joined the studio in 2003, has worked on several of the studio‚Äôs major titles, like Halo 2 and Destiny. Becoming CEO of the company in 2016, he helped launch Destiny 2 and worked with PlayStation on the studio‚Äôs controversial acquisition in 2022. For many, he has been the face of the company for quite a while, so the news is quite shocking.

Justin Truman Now CEO of Bungie, Replacing Pete Parsons

In a blog post on Bungie‚Äôs official website, memos from both Parsons and new CEO Justin Truman were posted. Parsons spoke on his leave, saying,

‚ÄúAfter more than two decades of helping build this incredible studio, establishing the Bungie Foundation, and growing inspiring communities around our work, I have decided to pass the torch,‚Äù Parsons said. ‚ÄúThis journey has been the honor of a lifetime. I am deeply proud of the worlds we‚Äôve built together and the millions of players who call them home ‚Äì and most of all I am privileged by the opportunity to work alongside the incredible minds at Bungie.‚Äù

New Bungie CEO, Justin Truman, also spoke on the matter in the post previously mentioned, stating,

‚ÄúI am committed to supporting and working alongside every member of the team here as we continue pouring our hearts and souls into these worlds,‚Äù says Truman. Worlds that we love, and that we hope have been worth your time and your passion. Because ultimately those worlds only exist, and thrive, with you in them. We are hard at work right now doing that ‚Äì both with Marathon and Destiny. We‚Äôre currently heads down, but we‚Äôll have more to show you in both of these worlds later this year.‚Äù

Truman, who joined Bungie in 2010 to work on Halo Reach as an engineer, has spearheaded much of Destiny 2‚Äôs community efforts. In the game, he worked as the Gameplay Experience Director. It seems like the Bungie CEO change isn‚Äôt going to delay Marathon or Destiny, as far as we know. While Destiny 2 is still going strong with new expansions, Marathon has had some tough times getting out of the gate. Still, the multiplayer FPS plans to release before the fiscal year ends, though exact details are not clear.

Are you surprised by Parsons‚Äô decision to leave Bungie? Do you think Truman is the best choice for CEO? Let us know in the comments and on the forums

item.title: Escape From Tarkov 1.0 Release Date Announced
item.content:encoded:
After eight years, Escape From Tarkov is finally leaving beta as the release date for Version 1.0 has been announced.

In a trailer posted online, Battlestate Games revealed that Escape From Tarkov 1.0 will launch on November 15, 2025. The release comes over eight years after it first entered beta and 13 years after initial development began.

What to Expect From Escape From Tarkov 1.0

While no details of what will be in 1.0 were given with the announcement, past reveals should give players an idea of what to expect. First thing‚Äôs first, Escape From Tarkov 1.0 is expected to include a dedicated storyline that will see you actually attempt to, as the name suggests, escape from Tarkov. Escaping will then see your character reset, starting things fresh.

In addition to the storyline, elements such as clans and more factions are also slated to be added. Lastly, a vast amount of gameplay updates and changes to mechanics, maps, weapons, and more should come.

Currently, you can buy Escape From Tarkov on PC for $50 for the Standard Edition for the game. There are three other editions, including a $250 ‚ÄúUnheard‚Äù Edition that gives access to future DLC, Escape From Tarkov: Arena, and the game‚Äôs PvE mode.

Are you excited to finally see what Escape From Tarkov version 1.0 looks like when it launches in November? Let us know down below, and take the discussion even further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: ‚ÄòJust Get Ready For It‚Äô: GTA 5 Leads Give Advice to GTA 6 Actors
item.content:encoded:
I made my way to the ROG super-sized booth at Gamescom, and who did I bump into but Shawn Fonteno and Ned Luke, otherwise known as Franklin Clinton and Michael de Santa from 2013‚Äôs Grand Theft Auto 5. The pair were there with ROG and were promoting the new ROG Xbox Ally X, but I pulled them aside for a brief chat, diving quickly into the topic of Grand Theft Auto 6.

Amidst their impressions of the trailers and what they‚Äôre most excited for, I asked Ned and Shawn if they‚Äôd imparted any GTA-related wisdom on the actors in Grand Theft Auto 6.

‚ÄòIt‚Äôll Probably Last Another 10, 15, 20 Years‚Äô

Even now, the actors behind Lucia and Jason in Grand Theft Auto 6 haven‚Äôt been confirmed, but people have their suspicions. When I ran into Shawn Fonteno and Ned Luke at Gamescom, I knew I had an opportunity to delve into the topic with some of the most in-the-know people: the most recent lead actors in the Grand Theft Auto franchise.

With that in mind, I asked Shawn if he‚Äôd had the opportunity to impart his wisdom and experience on the new generation of actors in GTA 6:

If I knew who they were, I would. I tell them in interviews to get ready, you know? (They‚Äôre) fitting to go on a great ride, it‚Äôll probably last another 10, 15, 20 years or something. Just get ready for it, it‚Äôs an experience that me, Ned, Steven, the whole GTA 5 cast, we‚Äôre still riding this wave.

Either Fonteno was playing coy with me, or he genuinely doesn‚Äôt know who is behind Lucia and Jason in Grand Theft Auto 6.

What Ned and Shawn said makes complete sense, though. In 2013, Grand Theft Auto hit the shelves and never saw any additional story content or expansions released. They stepped into the booth roughly between 2010 and 2013, and then as soon as the game came out, they never looked back.

And yet here they are, 12 years later, still beloved parts of a thriving GTA community.

That‚Äôs what Ned alluded to:

You can‚Äôt imagine what it‚Äôs like. We love our fans, they‚Äôre awesome, they‚Äôre very loyal. The thing that‚Äôs great about our fans is that they appreciate us, and they don‚Äôt really know that we appreciate them more than they appreciate us. If we didn‚Äôt have the fans, we‚Äôd have nothing. We‚Äôre lucky to have that.

Grand Theft Auto 6 will be released in May 2026. Until then, millions of fans worldwide will continue to explore the story portrayed by Shawn Fonteno, Ned Luke, and Steven Ogg (Trevor Philips) more than a decade ago.
